[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/function_info.rs] [Function: native_check_dispatch_type_compatibility_impl()] [Module ID equality] The check lhs_id != rhs_id prevents self-dispatch - but can attackers deploy identical modules at different addresses to bypass this check while creating infinite recursion? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/function_info.rs] [Function: native_check_dispatch_type_compatibility_impl()] [Abort code collision] Both module loading failures return abort code 2 - can this ambiguity be exploited to hide which validation check actually failed, aiding attacker reconnaissance? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/function_info.rs] [Function: native_check_dispatch_type_compatibility_impl()] [Load order dependency] rhs is loaded before lhs - does this ordering matter for security, or can reversing the order cause different traversal context states leading to bypasses?
